alert.note: Alert for Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 2:07PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact areas in and around Window Rock in Apache County through 245 PM MST... At 206 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Window Rock, or 22 miles northwest of Gallup, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Defiance, Window Rock, Tse Bonito and St. Michaels. This includes State Route 264 between mile markers 462 and 475. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
